snippet: Andrew Hamilton, a British-born chemist, will take over for Dr. Sexton, who has increased the university’s prestige while pursuing contentious campus expansions in New York City and abroad.
abstract: New York University names Andrew Hamilton, currently the head of Oxford University, as its 16th president; Hamilton will replace John Sexton following vote of no confidence in 2013; will face series of financial and logistical challenges as University pursues ambitious international expansion.

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Andrew Hamilton, a British-born chemist, will take over for Dr. Sexton, who has increased the university’s prestige while pursuing contentious campus expansions in New York City and abroad.

headline.main: Named Next President of N.Y.U., Oxford’s Leader Inherits Challenges From John Sexton
headline.print_headline: Named Next President of N.Y.U., Oxford’s Leader Inherits Challenges
